comment: PRE-REVIEW: COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter -- title: "Agent Hub GUI Scaffold", revision_summary: "Initial draft" (appropriate for v0.1). (2) All 12 required CR sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present and complete. (3) No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) in pre-approved sections 1-9. (4) Traceability -- CR-067 referenced as dependency, confirmed CLOSED v2.0. (5) No typos or formatting errors found. (6) Section numbering sequential and correct. (7) Technology stack, WebSocket protocol, and implementation plan are well-defined with seven concrete execution items. No TU assignment required -- genesis sandbox with no existing domain jurisdiction.

POST-REVIEW: COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter -- title: "Agent Hub GUI Scaffold", revision_summary: "Execution complete â€” all 7 EIs pass, GUI scaffold built and verified" (descriptive, appropriate for post-execution). (2) All 12 required CR sections per SOP-002 Section 6 present and complete. (3) No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) found. The "(coming soon)" text on lines 85-88 is literal UI copy for future sidebar sections, not incomplete document content. (4) Execution table: all 7 EIs have Task Outcome = Pass, Performed By and Date populated. No failed EIs, no VARs required. (5) Execution Comments present with 3 entries documenting deviations (xterm v6 rename, manual Tauri scaffold, VS Build Tools requirement). (6) Execution Summary includes build verification evidence: TypeScript (tsc --noEmit clean), Vite (build produces 493KB JS + 10KB CSS), Cargo (cargo check clean). (7) No controlled documents modified requiring EFFECTIVE status -- genesis sandbox per SOP-005. (8) No SDLC prerequisites -- Section 7.2 confirms no SDLC docs. (9) CR-067 dependency confirmed CLOSED v2.0. (10) Formatting consistent, section numbering sequential, no typos found. OBSERVATION: Section 11 discloses that live integration testing against a running Hub was not performed during execution. Build compilation evidence is documented. This is noted as a transparency disclosure, not a compliance deficiency, given the scaffold nature of the CR.
